comment: Let age in bottle at room temp (68-72F) for 8-12 months.
Soak American oak cubs in Brandy for 2 weeks. strain off remaining liquid and place oak cubs and beer into a secondary for 30 days.
wow you can brew this one on Christmas one year and leave the first bottle for Santa the next.
Yep! I was going to brew this next week but have changed my mind. I am going to wait until October-November, it will be ready to drink by next Christmas.
One thing that I would do is use a yeast that can handle this beer, 05 will not cut it, I think you would be better off with a yeast that can go up to and over 10%.
The original recipe that I got from this video call's for US-05 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWIw4JCcXKI
Thanks for the advice. I will have to look into this more. maybe I should us S-33?
